Articles.Content:
Hi all,

 

 I have these things called eye floaters, a few bigguns that are super visible on a white background.

 

 It makes viewing the forum really unpleasant for me, can I change the background to black? I don't really want to wear sunglasses each time..

Thanks!

 

MJ

While I don't believe there is a fix for it right now, I can assure you it is possible with the stylish addon. Someone more skilled than me is going to have to make it, however.

Edited December 11, 2015 by Sequinox

I have these as well, though they have reduced with age, I was told they would get worse but it's rare I see them now.

There's no alternative themes yet unfortunately, but @5thHorseman made me aware of a Chrome and Firefox plugin called Stylish which can change the forum colours until then.

Hope this helps!

OK thanks man, I will look into that. Also nice to hear they have reduced for you. They are an ever present part of life now.. It's a great excuse for wearing sunglasses though.

If you can deal with shades of blue, here's my Stylish theme in the Spoiler... Most of the gray text fades into the background however...(I have no idea how to change the font colors, or the post backgrounds in the Activity Streams... ) ... Theres still a lot of white in some backgrounds, but CERTAINLY much better than the stock theme we are (hopefully, temporarily) stuck with...

And you can adjust the width of the black sidebars by changing the % in line 58...

Spoiler

@namespace url(http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml);

@-moz-document domain("forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com") {


    /* font choice */
    
    div {
    /* font-family: Verdana; */
    }
    
    
    /* line height */
    
    .ipsType_normal.ipsType_richText {
    line-height: 1.4;
    }
    
    
    /* higher contrast */
    
    body {
        background: #000000; /* Old browsers */
        background: -moz-linear-gradient(top, #000000 100%, #ffffff 100%); /* FF3.6-15 */
        background: -webkit-linear-gradient(top, #000000 100%, #ffffff 100%); /* Chrome10-25,Safari5.1-6 */
        background: linear-gradient(to bottom, #000000 100%, #191970 100%); /* W3C, IE10+, FF16+, Chrome26+, Opera12+, Safari7+ */
    }
    a {
    color: #000000;
    }
    .ipsNavBar_secondary {
        background: #8cb2d9;
    }
    .ipsAreaBackground_light {
        background: #000000;
    }
    .ipsDataList.ipsDataList_zebra .ipsDataItem {
        border-left: 1px solid #000000;
        border-right: 1px solid #000000;
    }
    .ipsDataList {
        border-bottom: 1px solid #000000;
    }
    .ipsDataList.ipsDataList_zebra .ipsDataItem:nth-child(2n):not(.ipsDataItem_selected):not(.ipsModerated):not(.ipsDataItem_new):not(.ipsDataItem_success):not(.ipsDataItem_warning):not(.ipsDataItem_error):not(.ipsDataItem_info):not(.ipsDataItem_status) {
        background: #dde5ec; /* Old browsers */
        background: -moz-linear-gradient(left, #dde5ec 0%, #f4f6f9 67%, #e8eef3 100%) !important; /* FF3.6-15 */
        background: -webkit-linear-gradient(left, #dde5ec 0%, #f4f6f9 67%, #e8eef3 100%) !important; /* Chrome10-25,Safari5.1-6 */
        background: linear-gradient(to right, #c0c0c0 0%, #c0c0c0 67%, #708090 100%) !important; /* W3C, IE10+, FF16+, Chrome26+, Opera12+, Safari7+ */
    }
 
    .ipsWidget.ipsWidget_horizontal .ipsWidget_title {
        background: #000000;
    }
    
    /* wider page */
    
    .ipsLayout_container {
        max-width: 90%;
    }
    #ipsLayout_mainArea {
        padding: 0 10px;
    }
    
    
    /* denser thread lists */
    
    .ipsDataList_large .ipsDataItem_icon,
    .ipsDataList_large .ipsDataItem_main, .ipsDataList_large .ipsDataItem_stats, .ipsDataList_large .ipsDataItem_lastPoster, .ipsDataList_large .ipsDataItem_generic
    {
        padding: 12px 10px;
    }
    .ipsDataItem_title {
        margin: 0 0 3px;
    }
    .ipsDataItem_subList .ipsItemStatus:not(.ipsItemStatus_large) {
    vertical-align: 0.25em;
    }
    
    
    /* thinner borders around posts & articles */
    
    .ipsPad, .ipsApp ul.ipsPad, .ipsApp ol.ipsPad {
        padding: 5px;
    }
    .ipsComment {
        margin-bottom: 5px;
    }
    .cPost .cPost_contentWrap {
        padding: 20px 15px 15px 0;
    }
    
    
    /* code block scrolling */
    
    .ipsCode {
        overflow: scroll;
        max-height: 250px;
        background: #afeeee;
    }
 
    
  /* separate content from author */
 
  .ipsComment_author {
    background-color: #19334d;
  }
 
    
    /* separate content from status */
    
  DIV.ipsComment_meta.ipsType_light {
    background-color: #19334d;
    position: relative;
    border-left: 14px solid #19334d;
        left: -14px;
        width: 98%;
        box-sizing: content-box;
        padding: 7px 2% 7px 0px;
  }
    
    
    /* navbar tab corner nitpicking */
    
    .ipsNavBar_primary > ul > li > a {
        border-radius: 2px 2px 0 0;
    }
    
    
     .ipsBox:not(.ipsBox_transparent):not(.ipsModerated) {
    background-color: #95b6b6;
    }
    
    
      #ipsLayout_contentWrapper {
    background-color: #95b6b6;
    width: 100%;
    }
    .ipsBreadcrumb.ipsBreadcrumb_top {
    background: #95b6b6 none repeat scroll 0 0;
    border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.075);
    margin: 0 20px 15px;
    padding: 12px 0;
    }

    #ipsLayout_mainArea, #ipsLayout_sidebar {
    background: #95b6b6 none repeat scroll 0 0;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    display: table-cell;
    height: 100%;
        vertical-align: top;}
    DIV.ipsType_richText>P {
    -webkit-margin-before: 0.5em;
    -webkit-margin-after: 0.5em;
    }
    
}

Have a bit of patience.

"Eye floaters" sounds like something that sucks. You are for sure not the first who would prefer light text on a dark background, but your reason for it sort of takes the cake.

I'm now working on something more extensive than my first style mod. Since this will need to invert basically everything, it's going to take a bit longer. I've gotten far enough along to think that I'll manage to pull it off. And if I choose ugly colors, others may use it as a template / blueprint for their own version.

Watch this space.

Whoa, that was quite some endeavour, which depleted my coffee reserves considerably.

I have uploaded a new style sheet. It's not perfect, because it isn't even really finished yet, and probably has a number of weird bugs. But it DOES turn off the light, if I may say so myself.

I made a new post about it here:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/127797-made-a-new-forum-style-light-text-on-dark-background/
You could also try turning down your screen brightness.  I always do that at night anyway, whatever I'm looking at.
